item.description: Design Pattern Overview Q:What does a pattern do? A:Documents a recurringé‡å¤å‡ºç°çš„ problem/solution paring within a given context Essential elements Pattern name Used to provide a single and meaningful name to the pattern which defines a design problem and a solution for it. Naming a design pattern helps itself to be referred to others easily. Allows easy documentation

item.description: Qualities of a well designed software Correctness æ­£ç¡®æ€§ The degree with which software adheres to its specified requirements . item.title: Java_installation
item.description: Use Homebrew to install: // install the latest version $ brew cask install java // for the certain version e.g. java8 $ brew cask install java8 Set the environment variable: check the Installation directory in Finder. e.g. /Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_55.jdk/Contents/Home vim ~./zshrc export JAVA_HOME=/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_55.jdk/Contents/Home export CLASSPATH=$JAVA_HOME/lib/tools.jar:$JAVA_HOME/lib/dt.jar export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH: source ~./zshrc

item.title: Homebrew
item.description: Installation Search the location of xxx: $ brew search xxx Install xxx according to the location: $ brew install xxx $ brew cask install xxx Search the information such as version: $ brew info xxx Update Update Homebrew itself: brew update List newer versions of all the apps: $ brew outdated Upgrade // upgrade all $ brew upgrade // upgrade xxx $ brew upgrade xxx Cleanup clean up the old

item.title: Anaconda
item.description: Search the package: $ brew search anaconda and find it is in cask. Then install it: $ brew cask install anaconda Then export the environment variable: //zsh $ echo 'export PATH=/usr/local/anaconda3/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.zshrc $ source ~/.zshrc //bash $ echo 'export PATH=/usr/local/anaconda3/bin:$PATH' >> ~/.bash_profile $ source ~/.bash_profile and confirm the installation: $ conda â€“-version Finally set the default Python version: $ which python3.7

item.title: New terminal: iterm2
item.description: I’m writing to introduce two lovely apps to make our terminal more convenient and comfortable. Here are the leading roles: iTerm2 - macOS Terminal Replacement Oh My Zsh - a delightful & open source framework for Zsh Xcode The iterm2 need to be installed by homebrew, and before that we have to install the Xcode or Xcode command line tools first. For installing Xcode command line tools run: $ xcode-select

item.title: My first Mac
item.description: After having a permission of my parents to buy a new laptop, I was entangled with two types: Lenovo Ideapad Legion Y540-15 and A2159 Macbook-Pro 2019. Finally I chose my dreaming mpb for the convenience of building coding environments and helping me quit the gaming addiction(maybe). With the discount at the school starting time from Apple, I’ve got my treasure 13' Macbook-Pro 2019 wih 2 thunderbolt 3 ports/Ram:16GB/Memory:512GB with ï¿¥

item.title: Common Usages
item.description: Difference between ‘Null’ and ‘None’ There is no Null in Python, which means blank string str('') Difference between ‘is’ and ‘==’ == describes same value ‘is’ represents same object, including same addresses, same value, same everything.
